sentence.Network_en: Michael Stich then proceeded to snaffle the $2 million first prize.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着，迈克尔·斯蒂克又一举拿下了两百万美元的头奖。

sentence.Network_en: Don't forget to snaffle a snack mid - afternoon, to maintain your glucose levels.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要忘了在下午三四点钟吃点零食, 来保持体内的葡萄糖水平.

sentence.Network_en: Some are devout; others snaffle the odd beer or marijuana spliff.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们中有些人非常虔诚, 而另外一些却沉溺于饮酒或抽大麻.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 十九级词汇 - 豆丁网 ... sliver n. 长条， 细片， snaffle n. 马嚼子 snapdragon n. 『植物』 金鱼草.
smut 黑穗病snaffle 嚼子snail 蜗牛

list.abs: 相关短语:  ride sb. on the snaffle v. 用温和手段控制某人  four ring snaffle bit 双环衔铁到沪江小D查看snaffle的更多详细解释>&gt.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting a bridle bit): probably from Low German or Dutch; compare with Middle Low German, Middle Dutch snavel 'beak, mouth'. The verb (mid 19th cent.) is perhaps a different word

entry.def: A snaffle is an object consisting of two short joined bars of metal that is put in a horse's mouth and attached to the straps that the rider uses to control the horse.
If you snaffle something, you take it for yourself.

example.ex: Michael Stich then proceeded to snaffle the $2 million first prize.
example.tran: 接着，迈克尔·斯蒂克又一举拿下了两百万美元的头奖。

means.word_mean: 1. a simple jointed bit for a horse; without a curb
1. get hold of or seize quickly and easily;

sentences.sentence: "I snapped up all the good buys during the garage sale"

means.word_mean: 2. fit or restrain with a snaffle;
